snippet: Mr. Weiss met his future partner, Peter Fischli, in 1977. Their first collaboration involved photos of lunch meat.
abstract: David Weiss, one half of the Peter Fischili/David Weiss Swiss art duo, dies at age 65. Photo (M)0
lead_paragraph: David Weiss, one half of Peter Fischli/David Weiss, or Fischli/Weiss, a Swiss art duo known for sculptures, photographs and videos that enumerate, celebrate and ever-so-gently skewer the banalities of everyday life, and for ''The Way Things Go,'' one of the most acclaimed art films of the late 20th century, died on April 27 in Zurich. He was 65. The cause was cancer, said a representative of the Matthew Marks Gallery in Chelsea, which has represented Fischli/Weiss since 1999.

headline.main: David Weiss, 65, Artist on Team Celebrating the Banal
